page.title: 04A DAY IN THE LIFE OF PENTON
page.content: be around. The noisy crashing of the bins go and the churning up of the rubbish. Dickens and Shalacoe trot up the road with riders on top of them and it is nearly lunch time. The clip clop of hooves echo round the village. A few people go into Mr. A.F.Williams, the shop. In midafternoon people are playing tennis and you can hear the continuous rallies. Soon the children are coming out of school. The bus comes from Andover, picks up a few people and carries on down the road. Soon it gets very busy with everybody coming home from work and going through the village to their homes. The pubs open and the locals go in. The sun is slowly going down. The outside lights go on from the houses. People and their dogs go out for their evening walks. The lights in the
